Class Header

java.lang.Object
io.mindspice.simplypages.core.HtmlTag
io.mindspice.simplypages.components.Header
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component
public class Header extends HtmlTag
Header component for text headings with alignment and decoration options.

Headers support H1-H6 levels, alignment, and optional top/bottom dividers.

    • withId

      public Header withId(String id)
      Sets the HTML id attribute for this header.

      When set, this id will be applied to the DOM element, allowing targeting via CSS selectors, JavaScript, or HTMX.

      Parameters:
      id - the HTML id attribute value
      Returns:
      this Header for method chaining

    • render

      public String render(RenderContext context)
      Description copied from class: HtmlTag
      Renders this tag and all its contents to an HTML string.

      The rendering process:

      1. Builds opening tag: <tagName
      2. Appends all attributes: class="x" id="y"
      3. Closes opening tag: > or /> for self-closing
      4. Appends inner text (if present)
      5. Recursively renders all children
      6. Appends closing tag: </tagName> (if not self-closing)

      Example output:

      <div class="container" id="main">
  Hello World
  <h1>Title</h1>
  <p>Content</p>
</div>
      Specified by:
      render in interface Component
      Overrides:
      render in class HtmlTag
      Parameters:
      context - the context containing values for dynamic slots
      Returns:
      complete HTML string representation of this tag and its contents

    • render

      public String render()
      Description copied from interface: Component
      Renders this component to an HTML string with an empty context.

      This is a convenience method that delegates to Component.render(RenderContext) with RenderContext.empty().

      Returns:
      HTML string representation of this component
